title: Why does Riot still have one of the sh1ttest clients of any game?
body: How long is it going to take them to move away from this ancient client and upgrade it? The facelift was good but in the end a facelift is just a facelift the client still crashes and times out often etc.

replies.body: Why is MTGO allowed to exist in its current form? Because Wizards of the Coast, like Riot, don't view the money they would spend improving their client worth the money they'd make from having a better one. It's highly unlikely Riot are unaware that their client stinks; it's just not worth it to them currently to update.

TL;DR : We are working on something, but it is going to take time to roll out.  The client is a technology ecosystem that supports your pre-game experience. Upgrading this while maintaining client stability for players is difficult. (I.e. a good analogy is trying to upgrade an aeroplane while in air without affecting the passengers flight experience.)

"We’ve heard your feedback and know a new client is at the top of many wishlists. These changes are just the first phase of what will be an extensive and ongoing development process focused on improving the pre-game experience. Along with the visual changes to the patcher, a large part of this first phase involves introducing new core client technology. While this technology won’t noticeably change your pre-game experience, it will help us plan our future updates. That being said, our biggest focus is maintaining stability and making sure everything works smoothly as we continue updating the client. We're looking forward to sharing our long-term plans, but today's talk is going to be focused on foundation-setting."

Source: http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/patcher-landing-page-visual-refresh-pbe
